description: Erection of a rear extension at second floor level, over part of the existing back addition; erection of a rear extension at first floor level, over part of the ground floor back addition; erection of a single storey rear extension to the side and rear of existing back addition, following the removal of existing ground floor rear extension; erection of a pitched roof partial single storey side infill extension; alterations to the main roof to include, replacement of existing flat roof with new GRP fibreglass including a rooflight on top, replacement of the existing front and rear roof tiles with new slate roof tiles, installation of 2no. rooflights following the removal of existing in the front roofslope, and erection of new dormer French doors with a Juliette balcony and the removal of existing windows to the rear elevation of existing rear roof extension; removal of existing paint to the external front building facade; installation of new double glazed timber windows to replace all existing windows throughout; alterations to the front garden to include, new stone front steps, tiled front path, stone paving, associated hard and soft landscaping; and erection of a new low-level brick built front boundary wall with metal railings on top, following the removal of existing front boundary wall; installation of a rooflight, and replacement of existing roof tiles with new slate tiles on top of the pitched roof of existing first floor back addition; installation of an air conditioning unit, on top of the main flat roof and  flat roof of proposed single storey side extension; formation of a courtyard between the rear of the main building and proposed single storey extension, including replacement of an existing window with a new single door, glazed panels and a window to the side elevation; rebuilding part of the side garden wall in brick to adjoining neighbour (no.13); erection of a single storey outbuilding in the rear garden, following the removal of existing.
borough: London Borough of Hammersmith and Fulham
